description: Ghosts and weird mourners, horrible teenagers and disgraceful instructors. Haunted prisoners and seafolk taken from the shore. H. Pueyo's evocative writing takes notice that the dead, like memories, are often closer than we think, and the guilty are often ignorant of the damage done and astonished when they themselves suffer.This debut collection offers Pueyo's stories in both English and Portuguese.
